column5: Hope your kids get better bud.  If you want all come eat the pancakes lol mmm.  If theyâ€™re complaining of a sore throat give them un pasteurised honey on a spoon (teaspoon) and they will be golden for a while when they complain again another spoon. it a natural anti biotic I believe and works great to get rid of sore throats. once again hope they get better.
Too funny Mikey, sounds lke a Mr Mom Moment!!!
Once again Mike thanks for taking the time to write up that excellent report.  That is what I call chrome BLING BLING  BTW someone needs new gloves lol
Fantastic Report Solo!

Great job on the report Mike. What a trip!! I can't wait to get back there, I might head down next month if time permits.  Great meeting Dave and Mike and fishing with you. I'll second the need to make this an annual trip.
Show off   LOL...thats just incredible...sign me up for some of that!!!!!!   Thanks for that solo....enjoyed Part Deux as much if not more than the first instalment.
Way to keep up the suspence brotha!  Truly a wicked weekend and a stellar report.  If I may though, would love to see some fly fishing in your next report!  cheers H to the D

Wow, great report.  You've got it made!  Must be nice to catch numbers of those fish without standing shoulder to shoulder with long lines of fisherman.  You guys sure caught a lot of fish.  Awesome report and great pics.
WOOHOOO  that looked fun!

Great report, pics and videos Mike  Congratulation to all of you Thanks for taking the time to redo your report and sharing it with us  There's only one word that come to mind and it's "AWESOME" Again great job Mike  Leechman
damn. nicely done fella
amazing report..  ..you ever keep the count of the fish you catch ?
Mikey, thanks again for organizing that great trip - could not have had a better time.    Jay - great to meet and fish with you.  Perhaps it should become an annual roadtrip?

Kinda blew my milt all over the screen here Mike.  Some great fishing dood.  You're a lucky fella to fish so many world class fisheries... I'd maybe know.  The steelhead reports are second to none.  Is the Manistee your favorite 'er what?  Looks like there's lots of fish and elbow room down there.
Now that's some good fish porn right there.  Well done Mike and thanks for the report.
April 2-5 is already booked.
Are all the spots taken??? LOL  Just when I thought a steelhead report couldn't get any better, you came up with part 1 and part 2!! Awesome job on the fish and the report Mike.

Wow Mike, Those hens on the Manistee are truly the cleanest steelhead I have yet to see.....The colors are amazing and so clean/crisp... Love the new movies additions lately.. LOL @ "lower the rod and just suck em right in "...must be quite an experience  to fight steelhead with the pin from a boat deck..Got to book a trip one day..  AWESOME REPORT...I still had pics burned in to my head from the trip you made out there last year, and now this !!!

Thanks brother, and yeah the commentary was pretty funny at times  .  I'll tell you one thing though...the technique really works. Fish were landed in 1/4 the time compared to normal techniques.. I definitely learned something.

BORING!!!!! . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .  . . . . . . . . . Nice report buddy, wish I could have been there. I guess I will just have to cheer myself up by planning my Kvichak trip for next year.
FANTASTIC REPORT.  You got me holding my rod right now. Thanks for taking the time to post such a GREAT REPORT.
Thanks bud! That comment there deserves a response but I'm holding myself back here LOL!

WOW...another simply A M A Z I N G fishing trip/report mike !!!!.  ...man you sure have those steelies dialed in man !!! those fish all looked so strong & healthy too,  some great clips & pictures as well,that river looks very scenic too,and it looked like you guys had the river all to yourseves too,thanks for sharing mike,i sure look forward to seeing your reports bud !!!!....cheers
Love the bent rod fight shots.. that IMO is the joy of steelheading!
SPEECHLESS!!! SEE MR WALLIS IS STILL SNEAKIN AROUND  LOL GOOD WORK GUYZ
Heh - yeah Scott, still chasing steel though not as much now with a baby a home...
Excellent pics and story. Like the vids as well. Seems like the fish were affected by the cold front, more than one would expect.  Thanks for sharing, ehg

Thank you Mike.  I awoke this morning to sub zero temps and dreary skies, knowing that I would again be staying home with a sick little one, your report was the perfect way to start my day.  For a few moments this morning I wasn't sipping coffee in my kitchen, I was drifting along the Big M in my home state chasing steel.    Look forward to your next adventure.

Wow looks like a great time between a group of great guys.  Great job Mike as always the report was top notch.  Those fish are super clean and look extremely strong. hope your April trip is as good as this one.  Take care bud.

Glad to oblige Carole  . And I can relate. Joanne left Friday morning for Collingwood with her girlfriends (spa weekend). It's my weekend to watch the kids and both are sick as a dog, noses running like taps and inconsolable 'cause mommy's away.  I figured I'd make them a treat this morning so whipped up some homemade blueberry pancakes slathered with maple syrop. My 5 year old is just staring at her plate with an angry look. My 2 year old just whipped his entire plate onto my seisel rug.  I need help! LOL!
